intro: Adoxa xizangensis, commonly known as the Tibetan adoxa, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Adoxaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, showcasing adaptations to cold and arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
